definition: same as 剝皮|剥皮[bao1 pi2]
to skin/to flay/to excoriate/to peel/to bark at sb/to physically punish sb

sentences.english: Some blacksmithing recipes require leather, which you will need to buy from a skinner.
sentences.chinese: 某些鍛造配方還需要皮革，你可以從剝皮者那裏購買。

sentences.english: The cutting peels completion and peels available broad sword and double knife.
sentences.chinese: 切斷剝皮一次完成，剝皮可用單刀及雙刀。

sentences.english: Capacitor cores can be feed automatically and the lead wire will be skinned automatically, and the lenght can be set.
sentences.chinese: 電容芯子自動上料，引線自動剝皮，長度可以設定。

sentences.english: Peel the mandarin, remove pith and any seeds from each segment.
sentences.chinese: 柑橘剝皮，去除每一瓣的皮及籽。

sentences.english: You can it eat as it is –just peel and pop into your mouth.
sentences.chinese: 你可以把香蕉直接剝皮，然後直接把它放進嘴裏喫掉。

sentences.english: But peeling and chopping carrots, for example, can sap nutrients.
sentences.chinese: 然而，例如剝皮和切塊的胡蘿蔔會損失營養。

sentences.english: After peeling them, she got the eggs, cooked and hard.
sentences.chinese: 剝皮之後，女兒得到的是煮熟的雞蛋，硬硬的。

sentences.english: Thus the rods meet their process to become debarked.
sentences.chinese: 這樣的轉變表示這些柳條已經滿足了剝皮的要求。

sentences.english: Flaying is the removal of skin from the body.
sentences.chinese: 剝皮就是把皮膚從身體剝除。

sentences.english: In one hour, it can sheel about 56 kilograms of peanuts.
sentences.chinese: 在一小時內，可以剝皮56公斤的花生。

sentences.english: Cut off one-skinned, skinning available single-pole/double-throw and two-pole;
sentences.chinese: 切斷剝皮一次完成，剝皮可用單刀及雙刀。

sentences.english: Drain and cool slightly, peel and cut into cubes.
sentences.chinese: 撈出稍稍放涼，剝皮並切小塊。

sentences.english: The combination of cassette mold seat and stripping system can manage continuous operation.
sentences.chinese: 卡式模座和剝皮系統的組合使機臺達到連慣動作。

sentences.english: The supervisor said that the new potato peeling machine would come tomorrow .
sentences.chinese: 管理員說新的馬鈴薯剝皮機明天就送來了。

definition: both ends/both parties to a deal
